title: You want Tank Junglers to succeed? Give them faster jungle clears.
body:
Can't stand playing nautilus. Any jungler who farms faster than him will outdo him. And his ganks are as potent as someone like lee sin, or Elise who not only have some CC, but great damage to go along with it. 

It isn't an item causing tank junglers to suffer. It's the lack of farming.

replies.body:
Playing Naut Sej Zac or Maokai are basically saying " hey come steal my camps " 

If you give them faster clear times, they will be op since their incredibly strong ganks are balanced by their poor clears. 

Maybe have it to where you lower the defensive stats of junglers like Lee sin and Elise ( or increase the damage the camps do and buff the defenses of the champs that this topic is about and we can start to see more than 4 junglers.

That's not true at all. They don't have the damage, so it's easier to duel them. You shouldn't have slower clear times because you can gank well. You should have slower clear times due to how well you are able to duel. Pretty much ALL tank junglers suck at dueling, and that is the reason why it's so easy to invade them. Giving them faster clears will help mitigate it (not eliminate it) and will allow them to actually maintain levels isntead of falling behind.
I think you mean, they are invaded easily because of how well they duel.

its the lack of base stats/passive jungle clear ability

it makes no sense that nautilus has like 11 base armor when broken toplaners like jax have the highest base HP in the game
Riot won't nerf anymore toplaners though. It's rather dumb if you ask me.

Yes, but the lack of farming could be remedied by an item.

What if spirit of the ancient golem gave bonus damage against monsters that scaled with hp or resistances?
Couldn't they just give them random increased damage against monsters, similar to Fiddlesticks?
That's my thought. They need to be able to deal more damage to monsters, but not to champions.
